Sorry, I made a mistake. It was Morgan who ruined Tesla. 

Frank

----- Ori=
ginal Message ----
From: Frank Ratka <warrior18eii@...>
To: EVP-ITC@y=
ahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, November 16, 2007 7:51:32 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP=
-ITC] Oh Bruce...










  


    
            
Tell yourself whatever m=
akes you feel better or whatever allows you to sleep at night. Also, you ma=
y want to research into Tesla a bit more. He did not die poor! He died whil=
e living in an upscale hotel (the New Yorker) in NY, NY. Immediately after =
his death, all of his belongings, papers and research were confiscated by t=
he US government. The debt's that were attributed to him (and the reason wh=
y people thought he was poor) were with the very man that ruined his reputa=
tion, George Westinghouse.

Frank R.

----- Original Message
 ----
From: er=
ick hunter <erick_hunter9@ yahoo.com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Th=
ursday, November 15, 2007 6:29:14 PM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...



=







    
            
Thank you, Frank!  There you have it!  The last ti=
me I checked, the U.S. of A. was a "Capitalist" country...! That simply mea=
ns making or buying wholesale a product that will retail for more money tha=
n was invested thus making a Profit.  You want an example?  You just have t=
o look at Thomas Edison and Nickola Tesla.  Both were brilliant men,  pione=
ers in their field,  which was basically the same for both.  One was more b=
rilliant than the other,  in turn the less brilliant "stole" ideas and prod=
ucts from the other.  The most brilliant was not a "Capitalist" ,  he devot=
ed his time and efforts to "bettering the lives of mankind".  The lessor wa=
s indeed a "Capitalist" ,  his motives were less noble,  however,  and he w=
as willing to "better" mankind,  too,  but make a good profit in the proces=
s.  We all know the story...one
 is foremost in the eyes of the general
 pu=
blic,  became personally rich and famous,  while the other died broke and w=
ithout fanfare.  A shame,  but factual,  none-the-less.  Would you work for=
 free?  Would you supply people with something they want without recompense=
?  I think not.  I certainly wouldn't!  Get real.  Bruce is going to post a=
 capture, he says, from Nickola Tesla.  I predict that it will be a warning=
... "Don't Do What I Did!  Make a Profit!"    --Rod  
   
   
   
   
   
 =
 
Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@ hotmail.com> wrote:
     
  Well...Mean Bit=
ch week was last week, so I was trying to be nice. Yeah, I can make a box f=
or like $50 if it's on perf board, and $100 if it on PCB, the bare board al=
one is about $46. The only problem I have is the time. It takes two weeks m=
inumum to get a box together and working. Most people would like to get pai=
d for their time. I make about $40 an hour at my real job. ( been here 24 y=
ears!) Someday this stuff will get mass produced in China, and be included =
in every cell phone!

 
 Frank-S

      To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
From: =
warrior18eii@ yahoo.com
Date: Thu, 15 Nov 2007 08:54:53 -0800
Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

   
       I realize the time it takes to put things=
 together. Especially units built from the ground up but if you are taking =
on the duty of spreading the technology to help mankind, to me it would be =
a labor of love. I can see and accept recovering production costs even, but=
 this guy is looking to make a huge profit. 

You gained your respect and c=
redibility on the fact that you have a system that works and you are willin=
g to give it away when you didn't have to Frank. This guy is coming out of =
the gate with a cheap imitation of EVP maker and your system (both of which=
 are free) and putting a huge price tag on it. It just don't sit right with=
 me!

Honestly, I know it is none of my business what Ron does but I guess =
I just needed to register
 my protest with this
 seemingly blatant attempt =
at exploiting good though naive people.

Regards,

Frank R.

  ----- Origin=
al Message ----
From: Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@ hotmail.com>
To: evp-it=
c@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Thursday, November 15, 2007 10:17:20 AM
Subject: R=
E: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

    
 Interesting. I can see the price for early =
models. This stuff take tons of time to put together. I don't want to fault=
 anyone ---yet. I couldn't figure out how to sell the things, and keep it h=
onest, but all that does is deny everyone from using it.
 
 Frank-S

  To: =
EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com

 Wed, 14 Nov 2=
007 19:43:51 -0800
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Oh Bruce...

          $400 to $6=
50 dollars a unit. This guy is retarded! If he is selling this unit, he doe=
sn't get it Frank!

Frank R.
